question.prompt: What is the principal (chief) question or concern you have regarding your current condition?
In your own words, please provide a brief narrative of the details of the problem for which you are requesting a second opinion:
If you have been tested or treated for this problem?
If Yes, please provide the following information:
Regarding the treatment you received, how would you rate your overall satisfaction? (1 = not at all satisfied, 10 = completely satisfied)
Have you ever had anal or rectal surgery in the past?
If yes, please provide the following information:
Are you a female?
If yes, How many children have you had by vaginal delivery?
Have you had any vaginal or anal tear injuries as a result of any vaginal childbirths?
If yes, please provide the following information:
Did you have an episiotomy (surgical incision of the vaginal opening) with any vaginal childbirths?
If yes, please provide the date(s) of of Episiotomy(ies) below (month/year) :
Do you have a family history of any of the following conditions? (choose all that apply)
Do you have a history of any of the following? (Choose all that apply.)
Do you now have any of the following? (choose all that apply)

table_data.cell: Loss of control of bowel movements

question.prompt: Have you recently had an unintentional weight loss greater than 10 pounds / 5 kilograms?
If you have recently had an unintentional weight loss greater than 10 pounds / 5 kilograms, how much (in pounds / kilograms) and over what period of time?
Have you recently had an unintentional weight gain greater than 10 pounds / 5 kilograms?
If you have recently had an unintentional weight gain greater than 10 pounds / 5 kilograms, how much (in pounds / kilograms) and over what period of time?
Please list all diagnostic tests done and date done (choose all that apply):
How many bowel movements do you have in an average day?
Has the frequency of your bowel movements increased?
If yes, when did the increase in frequency occur?
Do you feel an increased urgency to have bowel movements?
If yes, when did the increased urgency occur?
Have you experienced a change in the consistency of your stools?
If yes, when did the change in consistency occur?
What is the general consistency of your stools?(choose all that apply)
Do you ever have mucus (white slimy substance) in your stools?
Do you ever have pus (green and / or yellow mucus) in your stools?
If you ever have pus in your stool, how often?
Do you ever have blood in your stools?
If you ever have blood in your stools, how often?
In general, how much rectal bleeding do you usually have?

selection.text: Large amount (colors the toilet water dark red)
Moderate amount (colors the toilet water light red)

question.prompt: What is the usual color of the rectal bleeding?
If other, please explain:
Are you having rectal drainage not associated with a bowel movement?
If you are having rectal drainage not associated with a bowel movement, what does the drainage look like (pus, mucus, etc.)?
Do you experience abdominal (belly) or pelvic pain?
If you experience abdominal or pelvic pain, which of the following describe your pain? (choose all that apply)
If other, please explain.
Is the pain?
If other, please explain:
Is your abdomen tender (sore) to the touch?
Do you experience abdominal bloating?
If yes, how often?
If yes, when do you usually get the bloating (i.e. after meals, at bedtime, etc)?
Please rate your abdominal pain below: (1 = minimal pain, 10 = worst pain)
What decreases your abdominal pain? (choose all that apply)
If other, please explain.
What increases your pain? (choose all that apply)
If other, please explain:
How would you best describe your energy level?
Which of the following best describes your appetite for the last month?
If other, explain:
Do any foods seem to trigger (cause) your bowel symptoms?
If yes, how often?
If yes, please provide the following information:
If you currently take any nutritional supplements (Ensure, Boost, Sustacal, etc.), please provide the following information:
If yes, how often?
If yes, please provide the following information:
Is there anything else you think would be helpful regarding your condition?
Please describe the therapies you have receiving over the last 3 months:

column_definition.label: Do you take anything to help with bowel movement?

table_data.cell: Laxatives(i.e. Ex-Lax/correctol. Colon Ease, Senna, Dulcolax, Lactulose/kristalose, Milk of magnesia)
Dietary changes (i.e. Dairy free, wheat free, IBS diet)
Pelvic floor rehabilitation (i.e. Kegels, Biofeedback, electrical stimulation)

question.prompt: How would you describe your Typical Bowel Movement? The word 'typical' refers to the bowel movement you pass most often.

selection.text: Type 1: Separate hard lumps, like nuts
Type 3: Like a sausage but with cracks in the surface
Type 4: Like a sausage or snake, smooth and soft
Type 5: Soft blobs with clear-cut edges
Type 6: Fluffy pieces with raqqed edges, a mushy stool

question.prompt: For patients with problems related to bowel control (Fecal Incontinence), please describe the type of bowel accidents and how often the accidents occur: (If you have no problems with bowel control, skip this section)
Does bowel incontinence effect your quality of life?
Do you have fecal urgency (the sensation that you need to move your bowels but cannot get there fast enough?
Do you have fecal accidents without any sensation that they have occured (passive Fecal Incontinence)?
Please report the quantity of bowel leakage:

table_data.cell: Moderate (requiring change of underwear but not clothes)

question.prompt: Do you use any of the following protective garments for fecal incontinence?
How long can you hold your bowels if you needed to?
For Women: Please describe the type of accidents and how often the accidents occur:
For patients with difficulty moving their bowels or constipation (if you do not have difficulty with bowel movements skip this section):

table_data.cell: Frequency of bowel movement (using current therapy)
Unsuccessful evacuatory attempts (unable to move bowels)
Enema/Digitation(use of a finger to help move bowels)

question.prompt: On a scale of 0-10 with 10 being the worst, how would you rate:
Please describe your sexual activity:
